song.songdescription: Released in 1968, “Hey Jude” is a timeless ballad that features Paul McCartney’s soulful vocals.
This epic rock opera, released in 1975, defies categorization.
From his 1982 album “Thriller,” “Billie Jean” is a dance-pop masterpiece.
A rock-and-roll anthem from 1957, “Jailhouse Rock” captures Presley’s energetic style.
Released in 1989, “Like a Prayer” is a powerful blend of pop, gospel, and controversy.
The title track from Prince’s 1984 album, “Purple Rain” is an emotional power ballad.
Bowie’s 1969 hit “Space Oddity” takes listeners on a cosmic journey.
A rock epic from 1971, “Stairway to Heaven” is Led Zeppelin’s magnum opus.
Released in 1970, “Let It Be” is a heartfelt ballad that reflects on acceptance and finding peace during challenging times.
A stadium anthem from 1977, “We Will Rock You” is all about audience participation.
The title track from Jackson’s 1982 album, “Thriller” is a spooky dance-pop masterpiece.
A romantic ballad from 1956, “Love Me Tender” captures Presley’s tender side.
From her 1990 album “I’m Breathless,” “Vogue” celebrates the art of posing and striking a pose.
A revolutionary song from 1965, “Like a Rolling Stone” transformed folk music.
The lead single from Prince’s 1984 album “Purple Rain,” “When Doves Cry” is a genre-defying track.
